FuncDef:
The m-lag ipv6 address link-local command configures an IPv6 link-local address dedicated for OSPFv3/BGP4+ over M-LAG.
The undo m-lag ipv6 address link-local command deletes the IPv6 link-local address dedicated for OSPFv3/BGP4+ over M-LAG. The m-lag ipv6 address link-local command configures an IPv6 link-local address dedicated for OSPFv3/BGP4+ over M-LAG. The undo m-lag ipv6 address link-local command deletes the IPv6 link-local address dedicated for OSPFv3/BGP4+ over M-LAG. By default, the m-lag ipv6 address link-local command is not configured. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv6 address.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

ExtraInfo: You can run the m-lag ipv6 address link-local command to configure an IPv6 link-local address dedicated for OSPFv3/BGP4+ over M-LAG.
